programme.title: Kansas @ Texas
programme.desc: The No. 3 Jayhawks visit the No. 9 Longhorns in their final games before the Big 12 Tournament. Kansas, the conference's regular season champion, has won seven straight, starting with an 88-80 win over Texas behind freshman Gradey Dick's 21 points.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Host Rece Davis and analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis preview all of the day's action and discuss the biggest storylines in college basketball.

programme.title: Duke @ North Carolina
programme.desc: The Blue Devils (22-8, 13-6) and Tar Heels (19-11, 11-8) streak into their Tobacco Road rivalry in an ACC regular-season finale. Duke has won five straight while North Carolina has claimed its last three. Duke downed UNC 63-57 in February.

programme.title: UFC 285: Jones vs. Gane -- Prelims
programme.desc: Julian Marquez vs. Marc-Andre Barriault, middleweight; Viviane Araujo vs. Amanda Ribas, flyweight; Derek Brunson vs. Dricus Du Plessis, middleweight; Cody Garbrandt vs. Trevin Jones, bantamweight. From T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Arizona @ UCLA
programme.desc: The No. 4 Bruins try to strike back against the No. 8 Wildcats in this Pac-12 engagement. Arizona put a stop to UCLA's 8-0 start in conference play by winning 58-52 on Jan. 21. Lithuanian forward Azuolas Tubelis double-doubled for the Wildcats.

programme.title: Florida State @ Virginia Tech
programme.desc: The Hokies and Seminoles tip off in this regular-season finale. The winner will lock down the 11th seed heading into the 2023 ACC Tournament, beginning March 7 in Greensboro, N.C. Both programs enter the matchup sitting at 7-12 in league play.

programme.title: Oklahoma State @ Texas Tech
programme.desc: Kevin Obanor plays his final home match as the Red Raiders host their Big 12 foe, the Cowboys. Obanor averages a team-high 14.7 points per game and has made half his 294 shots from the field in 2022-23. Oklahoma State beat Texas Tech 71-68 on Feb. 8.

programme.title: Atlantic Sun Tournament: Liberty @ Kennesaw State
programme.sub-title: Atlantic Sun Tournament: Liberty at Kennesaw State

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: NASCAR Xfinity Series drivers compete in the Alsco Uniforms 300 in Sin City. John Hunter Nemechek took his third series victory in a weather-delayed Feb. 26 race in California. Josh Berry has two wins at Las Vegas Motor Speedway since September 2021.

programme.title: Butler @ Xavier
programme.desc: No. 19 Xavier (22-8, 14-5) preps for the Big East Tournament by hosting Butler (14-16, 6-13). The Bulldogs upset the Musketeers 69-67 in Indianapolis on Feb. 10. Eric Hunter Jr. flushed home the winning basket for Butler with two seconds left.

programme.title: Creighton @ DePaul
programme.desc: The Bluejays (19-11, 13-6 Big East) and Blue Demons (9-21, 3-16) prepare for postseason basketball. Creighton posted its 17th straight win over DePaul on Christmas Day 2022, as Trey Alexander's career-high 32 points paced an 80-65 Bluejays victory.

programme.title: Arizona State @ USC
programme.desc: The Sun Devils and Trojans drop the curtain on their regular seasons with this match in Tinseltown. California native Warren Washington posted a game-high 21 points for Arizona State in the Jan. 21 meeting, but USC still emerged with a 77-69 victory.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: NASCAR Xfinity Series drivers compete in the Alsco Uniforms 300 in Sin City. John Hunter Nemechek took his third series victory in a weather-delayed Feb. 26 race in California. Josh Berry has two wins at Las Vegas Motor Speedway since September 2021.

programme.title: Connecticut @ Villanova
programme.desc: No. 14 UConn (23-7, 12-7 Big East) battles against Villanova (16-14, 10-9). The Huskies defeated the Wildcats 74-66 on Dec. 28, 2022, for the 14th and final victory of their season-opening win streak. Jordan Hawkins (CONN) scored 22 points.

programme.title: On This Day
programme.sub-title: 1973: New York Knicks at Baltimore Bullets
programme.desc: Archie Clark, 24 pts and 8 ast, led the Bullets past a red hot Walt Frazier, 26 pts, 6 ast, and 7 rbs, as the Bullets hung on to beat the Knicks 106-97 at the Cole Field House in College Park, Maryland. From March 4, 1973.
